diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: E.coli and bacteroides bacteremia/biliary sepsis, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, complete heart block, hypertension, gout, anxiety
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe abdominal pain primarily in the epigastrium, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Laboratory findings indicated the presence of gram-negative rods, suggesting a bacterial infection. The clinical picture evolved to include fevers and had similarities to a previous episode of abdominal discomfort. Given the symptoms, findings, and microbiological evidence, cholecystitis was identified as the primary diagnosis.
